toc_entry.title: The Texas Food Manifesto
toc_entry.description: Fie on the cilantro fad, greaseless barbecue, and indiscriminate mesquite-grilling. Let’s hear it for Frito pie, catfish plates, and other gems of Texas’ true cuisine.

toc_entry.title: Cosmic Plowboy
toc_entry.description: Agriculture commissioner Jim Hightower discovered that he could help the little guy by becoming one of the big boys.

toc_entry.title: Pearl Harbor Christmas
toc_entry.description: December 1941 in Clarksville was a time to celebrate peace on earth amid the rumblings of war.

toc_entry.title: Grande Dame Of the Gulf
toc_entry.description: She may be past her prime, but Galveston still clings to her aristocratic heritage and her precarious place on the sand.

toc_entry.title: Christmas On the Range
toc_entry.subtitle: Texas Primer
toc_entry.description: Yes, Virginia Sue, Texas really does have its own holiday traditions

toc_entry.title: Pancho Villa’s Last Gasp
toc_entry.description: In death as in life, the Mexican revolutionary is still causing trouble. This time the border skirmish is over his death mask.

toc_entry.title: Another Pilgrim’s Progress
toc_entry.subtitle: Books
toc_entry.description: The last book by native Texan William Goyen, arcadio is a weird and wonderful fable about a search for self-acceptance and peace.

toc_entry.title: Secrets Of a Deep, Dark Game
toc_entry.subtitle: Sports
toc_entry.description: Listen up, you Monday morning quarterbacks. How much do you really know about the classic triple option?

toc_entry.title: Good Christian Pageant Fans, Rejoice
toc_entry.subtitle: Church
toc_entry.description: Houston s First Baptist Church wants to be number one in Texas, and an eyepopping Christmas spectacle is one way it beckons the faithful.

toc_entry.title: Terminal Endearment
toc_entry.subtitle: Movies
toc_entry.description: Terms of Endearment features a Houston setting but also drab cinematography and cramped direction. The sickening Star 80 goes too far; the impressionistic Rumble Fish reaches too high.

toc_entry.title: The Courage Of Their Compositions
toc_entry.subtitle: Classical Music
toc_entry.description: These days the Houston Symphony Orchestra isn't playing the same old thing. Conductor Sergiu Comissiona battles boredom by playing brand-new works and little-heard older ones.

toc_entry.title: The Proof Is In the Piano
toc_entry.subtitle: Jazz
toc_entry.description: Fabled Texas pianist Peck Kelley appears, at last, on a gold mine of an album. There’s lodes more with Red Garland, Pete Petersen, and other jazz whizzes.

toc_entry.title: The Roar Of the Crowd
toc_entry.description: Banks play domino, Presidio plays it cool, Beaumont plays to win.

toc_entry.title: Around the State
toc_entry.description: A selective statewide guide to amusements and events.

toc_entry.title: Reporter
toc_entry.description: Masons in trouble; Wally in wonderland; vice in amarillo; vitamins in Mount Pleasant; Czechs in print.

toc_entry.title: Touts
toc_entry.description: The halls are alive with the sound of music.

toc_entry.title: State Secrets
toc_entry.description: More trouble ahead for Jim Mattox; oil pipeline for sale—cheap; the EPA gets dumped over toxic dumping; raindrops on GTE’s head at Braniff Place.
